DOC.detailed_description: Opioid withdrawal symptom major contribute factor opioid treatment program often fail . Individuals severe opioid withdrawal may experience shaking , muscle bone pain , nausea , depression , anxiety , drug craving . Buprenorphine , medication use treat opioid addiction , work lessen withdrawal symptom . However , past research show individual use buprenorphine risk abuse drug . Naloxone , another medication , currently use treat substance addiction . It also use combination buprenorphine reduce risk buprenorphine abuse individual physically dependent upon opioids . The purpose study compare abuse potential buprenorphine versus buprenorphine naloxone combination non-dependent opioid user . This 7-week study enroll non-dependent opioid user . Participants take part two medication challenge session per week . At challenge session , participant randomly assign receive varying dos either buprenorphine ; buprenorphine naloxone combination ; hydromorphone , medication use treat moderate severe pain ; placebo . Buprenorphine naloxone administer tablet dissolve tongue . Hydromorphone inject . During challenge session , participant complete performance task measure psychomotor cognitive functioning .
